Passage: In 2010, the specific situation of schools in a country providing training for teachers is as follows: 38% of public schools have 1%-25% of teachers attend, 18% of public schools have 26%-50% of teachers attend, 13% of public schools have 51%-75% of teachers attend, and 30% of public schools have 76% or more teachers attend in such training. In contrast, 37% of rural schools have 1% -25% of teachers attend, 20% of rural schools have 26%- 50% of teachers attend, 12% of rural schools have 51%-75% of teachers attend, and 29% of rural schools have 76% or more teachers attend. This shows that teachers in rural schools in the country are equally likely to receive training as school teachers in cities, suburbs and towns.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?
A. A.The contents of teacher training are rich and varied.
B. B.The conditions of teacher training are very different, and the effects are also different.
C. C.Some teachers work in public schools as well as part-time jobs in rural schools.
D. D.There are also many public schools in the countryside and many rural schools in the suburbs.
Answer:

Passage: British scientists wrote in the November 11, 2010 issue of the journal Nature and pointed out that they had found fossilized bacteria in Scottish rocks that might have lived about 1.2 billion years ago. This suggests that the concentration of oxygen on Earth has increased to the level needed for human evolution. This major event took place 1.2 billion years ago and it was 400 million years earlier than scientists previously thought. The new research is expected to give scientists a new understanding of the timetable for the evolution of the Earth's atmosphere and the life that depends on it for a living.Question: Which of the followings is assumed by the above findings of scientists?
A. A.It was previously thought that human evolution took place about 800 million years ago.
B. B.The bacteria began to use oxygen in chemical reactions about 1.2 billion years ago to gain energy to survive.
C. C.The increase in the concentration of oxygen indicates that the organisms that dominate the earth have changed from simple organic matter to complex multicellular organic matter.
D. D.Only the concentration of oxygen in the atmosphere increases to a critical point can some bacteria survive.
Answer:

The consulting company sent Dr. Zhang to investigate the period of the publishing of the target newspaper. There is a morning paper in the morning, a daily newspaper in the morning and an evening paper in the afternoon, all of which are not prepared for night. Dr. Zhang suggested that they should set up a "Metropolitan Night News" to occupy this market.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can properly point out the problems in Dr. Zhang's analysis?
A. A.The period of the publishing of the newspaper and the reading time of the reader may be different.
B. B.The lights in bars or cinemas are too dim to read newspapers.
C. C.Many people have the habit of reading before going to bed, but few read newspapers.
D. D.In the evening, people are used to watching TV programs and seldom read newspapers.
Answer:

Passage: The Chinese surname has a very big characteristic, that is, it is the same Han surname, but it is likely to have a very big difference in consanguinity. Generally speaking, taking Wuyishan-Nanling as the boundary, the consanguinity of Chinese surnames is obviously divided into two branches: the north and the south.The consanguinity of the Han nationality between the two places is quite different, even greater than that between the Han nationality in the north and south and the local ethnic minorities. This shows that with the expansion of the population, the Han nationality continued to go south and crossed the Yangtze River into Huguang more than 2000 years ago, and finally crossed the strait to Hainan Island. During this process, the Han people who moved south continued to integrate with many ethnic minorities who spoke Dong-Tai, South Asian and Miao languages, thus diluting the consanguinity of the Han nationality in the north.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?
A. A.The ethnic minorities in the south may have been the northerners who migrated to the south a long time ago.
B. B.Feudal emperors once sealed some of the ethnic minorities with the surnames of emperors.
C. C.The north and south branches with the same surname may not come from the same ancestor.
D. D.In history, there have also been cases in which ethnic minorities moved northward.
Answer:

A. A.Zhao chose to travel by car.
B. B.Zhao does not choose to travel by car.
C. C.Li chose to travel by ship.
D. D.Zhang chose to travel by plane.

Passage: Faith is the foundation of morality. Morality without faith is water without a source and a tree without roots. People without faith have no moral bottom line; and once a person has no moral bottom line, then the law is not binding on him. Law, morality and faith are the basic guarantee of the harmonious operation of the society, and faith is the cornerstone of the harmonious operation of the society.Question: According to the above statement, which of the followings can be inferred?
A. A.Morality is one of the cornerstones of the harmonious operation of society.
B. B.If a person has faith, the law is binding on him.
C. C.Only when the society operates harmoniously can the foundation of morality and belief come into being.
D. D.The law is binding only on people of faith.
Answer:

In severe cases, it may cause vomiting or even fainting, and it can also cause skin freckles to increase in the future. Zhang San hopes that his child can go to a famous university. If he sees the grades his child are not satisfactory, he will sulk.Question: Based on the conclusion of the question, which of the followings, if true, can best lead to the conclusion that Zhang San is angry?
A. A.Zhang San's blood pressure has increased.
B. B.Zhang San's blood pressure increased and vomited.
C. C.Zhang San's blood pressure increased and vomited. At the same time, Zhang San was accompanied by syncope, and the number of freckles on the skin also increased.
D. D.In the final exam of the semester,the grades of two of the son of the Zhang San subjects dropped.

Passage: Researchers at Ohio State University surveyed more than 13000 middle school students in grades 7 to 12. In the survey, the researchers asked the students to list five male friends and five female friends, and then counted the total number of votes received by the nominated friends and selected those who received five votes for the survey. The study found that among those who received five votes, the proportion of only children was consistent with the proportion of their population in this age group,indicating that there is no significant difference in social skills between them and non-only children, and this result is not affected by the age, race and economic status of their parents.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the above findings?
A. A.Among those who did not win the vote, the proportion of only children was higher than the proportion of them in the survey.
B. B.The proportion of only children who have won votes is roughly the same as their proportion in this survey.
C. C.Among those who got one vote, the proportion of only children was much higher than their proportion in this survey.
D. D.Among the top 500 votes, the proportion of only children is about the same as their proportion in this survey.
Answer:

It is understood that in the future, there will also be a CCD camera on the Chang'e-3 lander. At that time, it will not only take pictures, but also independently avoid the places where the lander is not suitable for landing during the soft landing, and the "immediate decision" will choose a flat surface suitable for landing for the lander.Question: Which of the following options can not be inferred from the main question?
A. A.The resolution of the CCD camera carried by Chang'e-2 is higher than that carried by Chang'e-1.
B. B.In the future, the CCD camera carried by Chang'e-3 will be more powerful than that carried by Chang'e-2.

Passage: Archaeologists from the University of York and the University of Manchester in England have found the remains of a human house with a history of more than 10,000 years in Starka, North Yorkshire. Dating results show that it is a round wooden hut about 3.5 meters high, which existed in 8500 BC and is at least 500 years earlier than the oldest house previously found in Britain. Archaeologists also found a wooden platform and the trunk of a well-preserved tree nearby. In addition, they also found ornaments of processed antlers, indicating that people at that time already had some ceremonial activities.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the above point of view?
A. A.The wooden platform is the workplace where human beings build small wooden houses.
B. B.At that time, the British already had a relatively stable address, rather than the previously thought of unsettled hunters.
C. C.Humans are gregarious animals, and there are more wooden houses waiting to be discovered nearby.
D. D.Only when ceremonial activities are held will the ornaments of processed antlers appear.
Answer:

Passage: There are thousands of genes in nature. Which genes are the most common and abundant? After successfully decoding a large number of genomes, a research institute found the answer: transposons, known as "selfish DNA". The abundance and breadth of transposon genes indicate that they play a vital role in evolution and the maintenance of biodiversity.Biology textbooks generally believe that the enzyme that can fix carbon dioxide in photosynthesis is the most abundant enzyme on earth, and some scholars have speculated that the genes that can encode this enzyme should also be the most abundant. But the study found that transposons, known as "junk DNA", instead dominate the known genetic world.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the speculation of the scholar(there is a version of the findings of the study)?
A. A.The basic function of transposons is to spread themselves everywhere.
B. B.The same enzyme is sometimes encoded by different genes.
C. C.Different enzymes may have the same gene to encode.
D. D.Different enzymes require different genes to encode.
Answer:

Passage: The results of experiments that some volunteers took part in to assess the sweetness of drinks showed that those who regularly drank sugary drinks and were fatter rated the sweetness of the same drink lower than those of normal size. This shows that their taste buds are less sensitive to sweetness. The results also show that people who are fatter tend to choose sweeter foods subconsciously. This suggests that eating too much sugar may form a vicious circle, that is, eating sugar regularly will lead to a decrease in the sensitivity of taste buds to sweetness, and a decrease in satisfaction caused by eating the same amount of sugar, which will subconsciously ask for more sugar. The result is that eating too much sugar leads to obesity.Question: Which of the following options does not support the above argument?
A. A.There are criterias for evaluating the sweetness of drinks.
B. B.The volunteers were able to evaluate the sweetness of the drink more accurately.
C. C.People who like sweets often can't resist the temptation of sweetness.
D. D.Satisfaction is dominated by the subconscious.
Answer:

Passage: Using the X-ray technology of the European Synchrotron radiation Accelerator, the researchers scanned a fossil of a true-footed snake hidden in an ancient rock dating back 9500 million years. It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the views of the above scholars?
A. A.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from non-footed animal to legged lizards.
B. B.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from a legged animal to non-footed animal.
C. C.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes degenerated from non-footed animal to a legged lizard.
D. D.The age of this true-footed snake coincides with the period when snakes degenerated from a legged animal to a non-footed animal.
Answer:

Passage: A researcher fed honeybee larvae separately with fresh royal jelly and royal jelly that had been stored for 30 days. The results showed that the larvae fed with fresh royal jelly grew into queens. Further research found that a protein called "royalactin" in fresh royal jelly can promote the secretion of growth hormone, making the larvae have the characteristics of queen bee, such as larger body size and well-developed ovaries. The researchers fed fruit flies with this protein, and the fruit flies also showed an increase in body length, number of eggs and lifespan, indicating that the effect of this protein on biological characteristics is cross-species.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can support the above researchers' findings?
A. A.The worker bees and queen bees in the colony are all female and genetically identical, and their larvae are no different.
B. B.There is little genetic difference between bees and fruit flies, and they share many of the same biological characteristics.
C. C."Royalactin" can only be stored for a short time, and it will be broken down into other substances over a long period of time.
D. D.The food for bee larvae that can grow into queens is royal jelly, while the food for other larvae is only pollen and honey.
Answer:

At that time, it will not only take pictures, but also independently avoid the places where the lander is not suitable for landing during the soft landing, and the "immediate decision" will choose a flat surface suitable for landing for the lander.Question: Which of the following options is most in line with the main point of view of the following statement?
A. A.It takes about 10 days for the local image of the lunar Hongwan area taken by Chang'e-2 to be transmitted to Earth.
B. B.High-resolution shooting of the lunar Hongwan area is the only mission of Chang'e-2.
C. C.While in a 100-kilometer circular orbit, Chang'e-2 took a local image of the Hongwan area of the moon.
D. D.Chang'e-2 took local images of the lunar Hongwan area while orbiting the moon in an elliptical orbit.
Answer:

prompt.content: Instructions: You will be presented with a passage and a question about that passage. There are four options to be chosen from, you need to choose the only correct option to answer that question. If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: Between the two "A" shaped tombs and the round rammed earth platform, five horse pits and a rectangular chariot pit were found. Six horses are buried in each of the two horse pits. The skeleton in one pit is neatly arranged in two rows of north and south, with 2 in the front row and 4 in the back, arranged in sequence from west to east; in the other pit, the skeleton of horses is arranged in a special way, with 6 horses in pairs or opposite sides, with different head directions. A special phenomenon is that a horn is placed in the middle of the horse pit, so it is speculated that the horse pit may be related to sacrifice.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the above speculation?
A. A.The horn is an important object in ancient sacrifice.
B. B.At the time of sacrifice, the horses sacrificed must be made in a consistent head-to-head shape.
C. C.Six horses are a basic form of sacrifice for ancient kings and princes.
D. D.The horn is placed in horse pits only during sacrifices.
Answer:
